intro: Kraenzlinella, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and showy, often yellow or orange flowers. The plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They typically grow as shrubs or small trees, reaching heights of up to several meters. Kraenzlinella species are often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and riverbanks.
